result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Scott Schwartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  Court grants 1 day credit.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.

Obtain GED.  No violent contact with any witnesses or victim in the Criminal Complaint.  Domestic Violence Counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program.  Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Scott Schwartz

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:00 AM Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court.   Defendant Justin Scott Schwartz did not appear.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.
Case called for status.
Defense anticipates a resolution and requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is to have no violent contact with Victcim A or B and that defendant not be home alone with victim B

09:55 AM Defendant Justin Scott Schwartz in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
All parties are in agreement to have this matter held before Branch 10
Atty Herbers does request an offer in this matter and has received all discovery  in this matter. 
Atty Herbers does request a bail modification to no violent contact in this matter. 
State forwards offer to defense counsel today. 
State was not prepared for a bail modification today and would like more time to review that matter. 
Court takes a brief recess. 
State did have time to meet with the victims in this matter.  
State does request no violent contact with Victcim A or B and that defendant not be home alone with victim B
Defense does not object. 
Court will modify to: no violent contact with Victcim A or B and that defendant not be home alone with victim B
Defense does request a new status date to allow his client to commence counseling.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney J Andrew Herbers

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant allowed one visit to the residence with police officer present to obtain his personal possessions.

01:59 PM Defendant Justin Scott Schwartz in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 02/22/2022.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
